intro: Helleriella guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrerensis Helleriella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive foliage and vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in the spring. Helleriella guerrerensis typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
